page.title: 15Foliejon Park Farm-1.
page.content: This farm consists of 2 farms run by the same farmer and his wife.It covers about 500 acres and is a{mixed farm growing{crops}and rearing{animals.}The crops are wheat,barley,oats,grass and broad beans. There is always some land which is left fallow. All the crops are used to feed the animals. 2 bulls, a Hereford and a Charolais, are kept for breeding and 50 suckler cows rear 2 calves each.There are about 300 pigs of the Large White and Saddleback breeds. There are 2 boars,40 sows and the rest are followers.Each sow has 3 litters a year and the piglets are reared to growers and sold at a weight of 40kgs when about 4 months old.A few Suffolk Cross sheep are kept,a ram,10 ewes and their lambs.Shearing takes place at the end of May and the sheep are dipped in June.The animals are sold at Slough or Guildford market.
